intro: Fumaria agraria subsp. merinoi, commonly known as the Merino's celandine, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
